00015 #ifndef __MLPACK_METHODS_KERNEL_PCA_NAIVE_METHOD_HPP
00016 #define __MLPACK_METHODS_KERNEL_PCA_NAIVE_METHOD_HPP
00017 
00018 #include <mlpack/core.hpp>
00019 
00020 namespace mlpack {
00021 namespace kpca {
00022 
00023 template<typename KernelType>
00024 class NaiveKernelRule
00025 {
00026  public:
00027   public:
00038     static void ApplyKernelMatrix(const arma::mat& data,
00039                                   arma::mat& transformedData,
00040                                   arma::vec& eigval,
00041                                   arma::mat& eigvec,
00042                                   const size_t /* unused */,
00043                                   KernelType kernel = KernelType())
00044   {
00045     // Construct the kernel matrix.
00046     arma::mat kernelMatrix;
00047     // Resize the kernel matrix to the right size.
00048     kernelMatrix.set_size(data.n_cols, data.n_cols);
00049 
00050     // Note that we only need to calculate the upper triangular part of the 
00051     // kernel matrix, since it is symmetric. This helps minimize the number of
00052     // kernel evaluations.
00053     for (size_t i = 0; i < data.n_cols; ++i)
00054     {
00055       for (size_t j = i; j < data.n_cols; ++j)
00056       {
00057         // Evaluate the kernel on these two points.
00058         kernelMatrix(i, j) = kernel.Evaluate(data.unsafe_col(i),
00059                                              data.unsafe_col(j));
00060       }
00061     }
00062 
00063     // Copy to the lower triangular part of the matrix.
00064     for (size_t i = 1; i < data.n_cols; ++i)
00065       for (size_t j = 0; j < i; ++j)
00066         kernelMatrix(i, j) = kernelMatrix(j, i);
00067 
00068     // For PCA the data has to be centered, even if the data is centered. But it
00069     // is not guaranteed that the data, when mapped to the kernel space, is also
00070     // centered. Since we actually never work in the feature space we cannot
00071     // center the data. So, we perform a "psuedo-centering" using the kernel
00072     // matrix.
00073     arma::rowvec rowMean = arma::sum(kernelMatrix, 0) / kernelMatrix.n_cols;
00074     kernelMatrix.each_col() -= arma::sum(kernelMatrix, 1) / kernelMatrix.n_cols;
00075     kernelMatrix.each_row() -= rowMean;
00076     kernelMatrix += arma::sum(rowMean) / kernelMatrix.n_cols;
00077 
00078     // Eigendecompose the centered kernel matrix.
00079     arma::eig_sym(eigval, eigvec, kernelMatrix);
00080 
00081     // Swap the eigenvalues since they are ordered backwards (we need largest to
00082     // smallest).
00083     for (size_t i = 0; i < floor(eigval.n_elem / 2.0); ++i)
00084       eigval.swap_rows(i, (eigval.n_elem - 1) - i);
00085 
00086     // Flip the coefficients to produce the same effect.
00087     eigvec = arma::fliplr(eigvec);
00088 
00089     transformedData = eigvec.t() * kernelMatrix;
00090   }
00091 };
00092 
00093 }; // namespace kpca
00094 }; // namespace mlpack
00095 
00096 #endif
